page.title: 01General Ecology
page.content: After the Ice Age the glaciers retreated into the sea, the area was more or less left to its own devices and finally reverted back to moorland. When civilisation finally came to the area the people were mainly farmers who set about cultivating the moorland where the richer soil had been deposited. The area at the present time is a mixture of moorland, covered with bracken, heather and gorse, part is also forestry and farms where the soil is more fertile. Many streams, becks, tarns and waterfalls cover the moorland making parts of the moorland boggy and rich in wild plant life. The area attracts much wild life, the moorland providing ideal cover and food for animals. The area is very open.
